fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48856].
  {panel}

h6. Problem Definition
It has been noticed that loading a particular Calendar on Team Calendars plugin results the poor performance should this calendar has a large number of Events e.g. it took more 50 seconds to load a particular calendar with more than 1000 events on it. 

h6. Suggested Solution
One of the suggested solution is to improve the handling of past events (either by adding a feature to remove it in bulk or archived it) as per requested in the following feature requests:
- [TEAMCAL-886|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-886].
- [TEAMCAL-269|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-269].
fields.summary: Performance Issue on Team Calendars with Large Number of Events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48855].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# In Confluence 5.5.3 create a space.
# Create a page inside of this space, with a Team calendars macro that has at least one event.
# Export the space.
# In a brand new Confluence 5.5.3 import this space.
# You'll see that the events will not show up there.
fields.summary: Space export doesn't bring Team calendars events.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48854].
  {panel}

*Steps To Replicate*
# Navigate to "Calendars" menu from the dashboard
# Ensure there are only 10 Calendars added in the system
# Click 'Add Event'
# Click on 'Calendar' dropdown box to see the data arranged alphabetically
!^cal1.png!
# Now add 1 more new Calendar
# Repeat step 3 and 4 to see the data is now ordered randomly
!^cal2.png!

_*Note: The same issue happens to page with Team Calendar macro. The only different is that the issue happens when there are more than 10 new/existing calendars added in the page.*_
fields.summary: Calendar Dropdown Is Not Ordered Alphabetically If There Are More Than 10 Calendar Entries

h3. Summary

When adding a new event, I can't use date picker to select start and end date.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.10.7
 * Team Calendars 5.3.14

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new event
 # Click on the starting date to bring up the date picker.
 # Select a date to populate the field with the selected date.

h3. Expected Results

The selected date gets populated in the field
h3. Actual Results

The date picker remains popped up and no update is made on that field.
h3. Notes

The date picker works with Confluence 5.9.X and Team Calendars 5.3.14.
I rolled the add-on back to 5.3.11 and found I was able to use the date picker succuessfully.
h3. Workaround
 * Input the date manually
 * Rollback to Team Calendars 5.3.11
 ** Uninstall Team Calendars 5.3.14
 ** Download Team Calendars [5.3.11|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars/version/2260]
 ** Install Team Calendars 5.3.11 via [file upload|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Installing+add-ons#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload]

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48836].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-3712

Even when the time zone is properly configured to that of the user's, the event in the series of events can't be deleted. This applies across all calendars in our instance. They appear to delete at the time of the action, but refreshing the page shows that the events is still there. There are no errors in the front or the back end, even with DEBUG logging for Team Calendars.
 

h3.Workaround To Temporarily Correct Issue*
# Log in Confluence
# Go to Team Calendars
# Select "Week" from the tabs to make the events easier to read
# Click on the event you are trying to delete and drag the event to an earlier time (e.g 30 minutes before)
# Try to delete the event we just moved
# You will likely get an error. You can ignore this error for now. 
# Refresh the page and the event will be automatically moved back to it's original spot
# You should now be able to delete any of your calendars and events.

Note: This is not a permanent workaround and the issue has been seen to re-surface after a few days. We recommend to upgrade Team Calendars to 5.3.11 for a permanent fix.
fields.summary: Can't delete event in Calendar from series of events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48834].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Confluence disabled users that subscribed to a calendar still receive notifications when calendar have new events added or when events in the subscribed calendar are modified. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new user in Confluence
# Make the new user watch a calendar in Team Calendar 
# Disabled the newly created user
# Modified or add a new event into the watched calendar 

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should acknowledge that a disabled users watched a calendar but won't process the notification as the users are disabled and therefore should not receive any updates/notification from Confluence as well as Team Calendar.

h3. Actual Results

Confluence process the notification and publish notification to disabled users.

h3. Workaround

Administrator could try to update all disabled users e-mail address to another e-mail address. This way, disabled users won't receive the notification from Team Calendar in their e-mail address. Please execute this SQL query:

{code:SQL}
UPDATE cwd_user SET email_address = '<enter email address>' WHERE active = 'F';
UPDATE cwd_user SET lower_email_address = '<enter email address all in lower case>' WHERE active = 'F';{code}
fields.summary: Disabled Users Receive Notification from Team Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48832].
  {panel}

One of our calendars, which isn't embedded in any page, has been sending email notifications to users who are not watching the calendar. Not all users are affected. There appears to be no way to unsubscribe them from receiving these notifications.

* The users' lists of watched items doesn't contain this calendar
* When the users access the Calendars page and select this calendar's drop down menu from the elipsis, they find that they are not watching this calendar (status reads "Watch" and not "Stop Watching" or "Watched")

I used this query to see if the calendar is embedded anywhere returned no results:

embeddedSubCalendarId:CALENDARID

This seems to be a known issue, as reported here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-3709

Is there any fix for this? 

*Workaround:*

(!) If you navigate to the calendar by following the link provided in the email notification, it has "Watch" instead of "Stop Watching" as the option. You can see the "Stop watching" option by following the specific instructions below to navigate to the calendar.

# Click "Calendars" in the top Confluence navigation bar.
# Locate the target calendar and click the ellipses button (!https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/704577869/704577870/1/1422393340385/ellipsis.png!)
# Click *Stop Watching*.
fields.summary: Users receive emailed notifications for calendars they don't watch

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the user creates the event with the custom event type and fills the field *Who* the content of Description filed is just attaching to Summary field. Both in the web interface and ICS formats. By the same time in AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS, the content of two fields is stored separately in the correct columns.

h3. Environment
Not environment specific
* Confluence 5.9.5 or Confluence 5.10.8 or Confluence 6.0.1
* PostgreSQL or MySQL
Team Calendars 5.3.15

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create custom event type
# Create new event of created previously event type
# Fill Summary
# Fill Description
# Fill Who
# Save the event

h3. Expected Results
In Calendar view only Who:Summary is displayed (in ICS all stored in separate fields)

h3. Actual Results
The web interface showing Who:Summary:Description.
ICS file has following content:
{code}
CREATED:20160509T074259Z
LAST-MODIFIED:20160725T090738Z
SEQUENCE:4
X-CONFLUENCE-SUBCALENDAR-TYPE:custom
TRANSP:TRANSPARENT
STATUS:CONFIRMED
END:VEVENT
BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTAMP:20161121T105800Z
DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20170123
DTEND;VALUE=DATE:20170125
SUMMARY:This is summary: This is description
UID: <Removed from the ticket>
DESCRIPTION:This is description
...
{code}

h3.Workaround
Keeping field Who empty solving the issue with appending the description to the summary of the event
fields.summary: Summary has both summary and description content in custom events

fields.description:
h3. Summary
_Group Search_ popup window once opened in Firefox and IE would only be rendered successfully after a long time (approx. 20++ seconds). The same issue is *not* observed in Google Chrome browser on reload.

h3. Environment
Tested on:
* Confluence: 5.8.5 and Confluence 5.9.6 - both are vanilla instances.
* Browser: IE 11, Firefox version 43.0.4, v45.0.1 and Chrome version 49.0.2623.110.
* User-base: Confluence Internal Directory with 1 user and 2 users groups (default config).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Team Calendars page ({{<ConfluenceServerBaseURL>/calendar/mycalendar.action}})
# Select _Restrictions_ from one of the existing's Calendar menu.
# Click _Group_ to apply restrictions to your Confluence's group(s).

h3. Expected Results
The _Group Search_ popup window would be loaded immediately.   

h3. Actual Results
Specifically in Firefox and IE web-browsers, the _Group Search_ popup window would only be loaded after approximately 20++ seconds.   

h3. Workaround
Disable *HTTP Compression* under Confluence Admin > General Configuration
fields.summary: Group Search on Team Calendars' Restriction Renders Slow

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Repeating events showing 1 hour difference before and after the DST change when Google/Yahoo calendar subscribes Team Calendar.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Set your Confluence timezone to {{(GMT+0100) Amsterdam, Berlin, Bern, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna}}
# Create a calendar in Team Calendar with the timezone (Europe/Vienna +0100)
# Go to October 2015, create a daily repeating event with time before 25th of October and ends at 31st of October.
# Note that Team Calendar shows all the repeating events at the same time.
# Right click the calendar and click subscribe and copy the link.
# Go to your Google/Yahoo calendar and set your timezone to Vienna (GMT+1). Under the "other calendar" add the URL and wait for it to load.
# You will find that the events before 25th October displays the time correctly. Events after 25th will show 1 hour earlier.

h3. Important things to note
# DST for Vienna ends at 25th October
# This only happens for repeating events
fields.summary: Daylight saving time causing 1 hour difference between Team Calendar with other calendars (Google, Yahoo)

h6. Summary
As of now Confluence Team Calendars plugin will show warning messages should a user subscribed to a restricted calendar (they've subscribed to it before hand) saying that the user doesn't have permission to load the calendar. 

However, this warning messages will be shown for every _Event Types_ available in that particular calendar, causing confusion to the user. 

\\
h6. Environment
Tested on:
- Team Calendars plugin version 5.3.9.
- Confluence version 5.8.15.

\\
h6. Steps to Reproduce
# User A subscribe to a Calendar that belongs to User B.
# User B then restrict this Calendar to himself.
# User A would then see duplicates warning messages as per shown in the attached screenshot (_ObservedBehaviour.png_).

\\
h6. Expected Results
No duplicate warning messages would be shown in _My Calendars_ page for each restricted Calendar that the user subscribed to.

\\
h6. Actual Results
 Duplicate warning messages (based on how many _Events Type_ are there in that particular calendar) are shown in _My Calendars_ page. Please refer to the attached screenshot (_ObservedBehaviour.png_).
fields.summary: Duplicate Warnings Should User Subscribes to Restricted Calendar

h3. Summary
If you create a new project the project in JIRA it will not be able to be added to an existing Team calendar under the *JIRA Project Releases* event type option

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud version {{5.9.1-OD-2015.45.2-0001}}
* Team Calendar version {{5.3.8-D20151021T015515}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a team calendar {{https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/display/<SPACE_ID>/calendars}}
# [Add Calendar | https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/create-add-and-edit-calendars-654213559.html]
# Go to JIRA and create a new Project as [described here | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/create-a-project-735940417.html]
# Go back to calendar
# Add event *JIRA Project Releases*

h3. Expected Results
Under Project Field the newly Created Project will be a selectable option

h3. Actual Results
The new project is not available
 
h3. Notes
Looks like a syncing issue with cach management, as it Requires manual cache flush to sync the new project with the calendar

h3.Workaround
*You Must Be logged in as a System-Administrator* to access the Cache management So Cloud users must file Support Request at https://support.atlassian.com to apply the workaround (Please reference this case in your request):
- Go to:
-- Confluence Administration
-- Cache Management:
--- {{https://<Instance_Name>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/cache/showStatistics.action#
- Select *Flush All*
~30 second wait no down time is required and New Projects are now available
fields.summary: Unable to Add Jira Project Release event for projects created after Calendar Subscription

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48783].
  {panel}

This search should return any items:

resolvedBy != "" and status was not in (resolved)

As an item that has never been resolved should not have a resolver. However, linked issues such as "relates to" and "clones" that have been resolved are populating this attribute.

This was noticed when the search: resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints() 

began returning extra items the given users had not actually touched. This can inflate and give inaccurate figures which need to be rooted out by hand or filtered with something more like: 

resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints() and assignee was in (user1, user2, user3)

But this is also inaccurate as a true resolver does not necessarily posses the item when resolving.
fields.summary: resolvedBy is populating from linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Reminder for all day events report wrong time.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an all day event in Team calendar
# Set e reminder for the event (1 day before, 2 days before...)
# Wait for the notification to be received

h3. Expected Results
The notification should show the correct time for the event (the day chosen for the event)

h3. Actual Results
The notification shows wrong date/time

 

!Screen Shot 2015-06-23 at 4.04.46 PM.png|thumbnail!

!Screen Shot 2015-06-23 at 4.03.02 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: If user choose "all day" on a event, the reminder will have wrong date
Update timezone alias for ical4j to be same as team calendars timezone alias

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the main Team Calendars interface (accessed after clicking the Calendars link in the main navigation bar), if you click the ellipsis next to a calendar the Watching Status never finishes loading. A user will simply see a spinning wheel

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Team Calendars 5.2.10 in a version of Confluence that supports it
# Click the Calendars link in the navigation bar
# Create a new calendar
# Click the ellipsis next to the calendar name

h3. Expected Results
Under Add Event you will see the current watch status options for the user for this calendar. If you are watching it, you will see Stop Watching. If you are not watching it, you will see Watch.

h3. Actual Results
The watch status does not finish loading, instead you see:
!watching_status.png|thumbnail!

There are no errors thrown in the logs, and when looking at the network requests you see that {{<base_url>/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/subcalendars/watching/status.json?_=1429650608481}} does finish loading and has a valid response. It simply looks like the next step isn't launched.
 
h3. Notes
* This only affects 5.2.10

h3. Workaround
* Uninstall 5.2.10 and install 5.1.21
## Go to Confluence Admin > Manage add-ons
## Expand Team Calendars
## Click Uninstall, followed by Continue
## Click Upload-addon at the top of the Manage add-ons page 
## Copy {{https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars/version/2160}} and paste it into the field under From this URL
## Click upload
fields.summary: Watching Status for individual calendars does not update, just shows spinning wheel

fields.description:
When adding JIRA content to Team Calendars, Confluence will reach out to JIRA to obtain options that are returned by the following JIRA URL: http://<jira_base_url>/rest/ical/1.0/ical/config/query/options

This options query times out after 10 seconds by default. Administrators can extend this timeout by following [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/JIRA+Calendar+Read+Timed+Out].

Through SQL logging in JIRA, we find that the following components appear to impact the query return time greatly:
* For every project, JIRA appears to fire off one SQL query for each role that exists. In other words, the cost is _number of roles_ times _number of projects_.
* JIRA fires off one SQL query for each shared filter (i.e. excluding private filters).

In one observed instance, there were:
* 1000 projects, 3 roles =  3000 SQL queries
* 15000 shared filters = 15000 SQL queries

Each query took 1-3ms including DB connection borrow and return. Adding latency and other overhead, http://<jira_base_url>/rest/ical/1.0/ical/config/query/options on this instance took 56000ms to finish, well over the 10000ms default timeout.
fields.summary: JIRA options can be very slow to return with a high number of Roles and/or Shared Filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48763].
  {panel}

h3. ***Current Behaviour***
The events are *not* updated in application subscription e.g. Google Calendar and iOS Calendar when changes are made in Confluence Team Calendar. This includes all types including recurring events.

h3. ***Expected Behaviour***
The events are updated in application subscription e.g. Google Calendar and iOS Calendar to reflect new changes.

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Create a Team Calendar
# Add events (any type)
# *Subscribe* to Calendar
# Subscribe to Calendar using URL (Google Calendar or iOS Calendar) 
# *Edit* event (Any form of edit, i.e change event name or date)
# Observe that the event is not updated in the subscribed Calendar. 

***Note:*(!) Even after 24 hours ([TEAMCAL-458|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-458]). No errors in the logs. This has yet to be tested on Outlook Calendar.
fields.summary: Calendar application subscription to the Team Calendar is not updated to new changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48754].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently there is a hard limit of 200 events in Team Calendars for the number of events that can be displayed in a single view at any time. However, the error message is set to show if there are more than 200 total events in the current view, the view before, and the view after, combined. For example, if you have the month of November pulled up with less than 200 events, but all events in October, November, and December equal more than 200, the error will display.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add less than 200 events for a month, but make sure to add enough events for the month before and the month after to go over the 200 limit when combined.

h3. Expected Results
The limit error should only show if the month/week/etc. the user is looking at exceeds 200.
 
h3.Workaround
None currently

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you add a JIRA Sprint Event in Team Calendar with a time range, the event is showing as All Day event in Team Calendar Week View. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a sprint event with Sprint Duration {{25/Mar/16 4:24 PM•25/Mar/16 6:24 PM}} in Team Calendar
# Switch to Week View 

h3. Expected Results
* JIRA Sprint Event should only be shown in the time range. 

h3. Actual Results
* JIRA Sprint Event is being displayed as All Day Event in Team Calendar Week View

 * !JIRA Sprint Event.png|thumbnail! 

Confluence Version: 6.0.0-OD-2016.12.2-1113
Team Calendar Version: 5.3.10-D20151229T094001
fields.summary: JIRA Sprint Event with time range is being displayed as All Day Event in Team Calendar Week View

fields.description:
*Steps To replicate*
# Install Confluence
# Install Team calendar
# Make one or 2 user watch the calendar
# Create an event in team calendar
# After creating an event, click edit and then click OK

*Observer behavior*
User receiving email notification

*Expected behavior*
User should not receive any notification since no changes was made
fields.summary: Receive notification although we never do any changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48743].
  {panel}

Hi Team,

My customer recently built an app link between JIRA and Confluence.
It's working well so far but we still have issues when adding JIRA Events. Whenever it's using JIRA's filters or JQL it's OK (for JIRA issue date it's working using Filters or JQL).
My problem is, whenever it has to fetch a project list, it appears to be empty! JIRA Issue dates from project is answering "No project found", using JIRA Agile sprint dates and project versions are not working as well since the project dropdown is empty!
When using JQL, I can use the autocompletion on "project" keyword...
Also, I configured the application link according to Atlassian documentation (especially about the URL Patterns).

Any clues on why it's failing?
Thanks team!

Cheers,
Micky
fields.summary: Project Field always empty when adding event in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48737].
  {panel}

I cannot download any of the source packages on https://my.atlassian.com/download/source/confluence-team-calendar.

If you click on any one of the links, this error message appears: "The Confluence Team Calendars source code is available to eligible license holders only. Please contact us if you have any questions about accessing the source code."

I came to the download page by clicking "Download Source" on https://my.atlassian.com/products/index#your_licenses, so I'm pretty sure we are an "eligible license holder"

Downloads of JIRA source packages from https://my.atlassian.com/download/source/jira work without any problems.

fields.description:
Embed links from Team Calendars 5.3.9 no longer work with Team Calendars 5.3.11 when added as "web link" or saved as bookmarks. The old links do still work for rendering the calendars on the pages so pages with embedded calendars still display as expected.

If the link on this screen shot is clicked:

!CalendarLink.png|thumbnail!

this page is shown:

!ResultOfClickingEmbedLink.png|thumbnail!

To reproduce:
# Install Confluence with Team Calendars 5.3.9
# Go to the three dots and choose Embed to get the calendar link
# Create a web link to the calendar
# Upgrade Team Calendars to version 5.3.11
# Click the web link
fields.summary: Embed links from Team Calendars 5.3.9 no longer work with Team Calendars 5.3.11

fields.description:
Steps to replicate :
# Install Confluence 5.10.7 and JIRA 7.2.6
# Install Team Calendar plugin
# Create a scrum project in JIRA
# Create a few stories and start a sprint
# Change the Display URL to something else (eg. http://test.com)
# Access Confluence and create a calendar
# Create a JIRA Agile Sprint event
# Select the scrum project that you have just created
# The scrum project should show up in the calendar
# Click the event and click on "View Sprint"

Current behavior : It does not follow the display URL (eg. http://test.com)
Expected behavior : it should follow the display URL (eg. http://test.com) .However it is following the application URL (eg. http://test.com/confluence)
fields.summary: JIRA event links in Team Calendar is returning Application URL instead of Display URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48733].
  {panel}

*Problem*  
User A creates a Calendar UserA (Caputure1.PNG) adds the Jira Issue Dates Event,  Issues are displayed as a one day event.  
User B Adds an Existing Calendar UserA (Capture2.png) Issues are displayed as a two day event.  
*Note:* If UserB adds Jira Issue Dates Event to UserB Calendar (Capture3.png) Issues are displayed as one day event.
{panel:title=How to Reproduce}
# Log in as user 1 in Confluence
# Go to calendars
# Add New Calendar
# Fill in details (Time zone: Europe/Amsterdam +0200)
# Add event under new created calendar
# Event details:
#* Event type: Jira issue dates
#* Display: project (Choose Jira project)
#* Show: all boxes checked
#* No date range selected
# The dates appear correctly (one-day events)
# Log off
# Log in as user 2 in Confluence
# Go to calendars
# *Add Existing Calendar*
# Search for calendars
# Add the calendar made by user 1
# The events appear, but spread over two days
{panel}
fields.summary: Add Existing Calendar renders Jira Event Times (Dates) incorrectly as  two day event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48731].
  {panel}

Step to reproduce the issue:

* go on your calendars
* select the "List" view mode
* click on an event, a balloon window with the details is displayed (containing Edit / Delete link)
* click elsewhere to make the window to dissapears
* click again on the same event, the details are no more displayed
* you need to refresh the page to be abble to see again the details

Identified in TCAL 5.2.18 (with CONF 5.8.5), the issue is also present in TCAL 5.3.4 (with CONF 5.8.13).
The issue occurs both in FF and Chrome (latest versions). And is present either on the "My calendar" screen or within the "Team Calendars" macro
fields.summary: Details of event can't be displayed twice in "List" view mode
ICS files: strange merging of SUMMARY and DESCRIPTION fields

h3. Description
An event will not be deleted when deleting a recurring event for only one instance.

h3. Reproduce
# Add a recurring event
# Click on it from the month overview
!image-2016-04-05-15-39-28-888.png|thumbnail! 
# Click delete and this instance only
 !image-2016-04-05-15-39-58-110.png|thumbnail! 
# The event dissapears (as expected)
# Refresh site
# The recurring event is back again
fields.summary: Can't delete Recurring Event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48728].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a space in Confluence.
# Add a new Calendar, and put the newly created space in "Related Space".
# Proceed to delete the Space from Space Tools.
# Login with a different user in your Confluence instance.
# Add an existing Calendar, and search for the Calendar you just created.  Try adding it.

h4. Actual Results
Nothing happens, and Calendar will not be added. 

h4. Possible Workaround
Creator of  Calendar can edit the Calendar and remove the Space name from "Related Space".

fields.description:
Subscribe via URL does not work with iCloud Calendar format

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Clean Install of Confluence 5.6.5
# Clean Install of Team Calendars 5.1.7
# Build an iCloud Calendar, share it publicly
# Gather the webcal URL from iCloud
# Go to configure Team Calendars, Subscribe by URL
* Try the URL: webcal://p29-calendarws.icloud.com/ca/subscribe/1/ylFkt2Busa4o9Y-5TIDGL1tXOsin82JyqCIun8t1amMo0PC97k4DZMZ84YsSdiGb
* Try as an http URL
* Try as an https URL 
* All attempts fail to connect as the error message is thrown in the attached images hereto

h3. Expected behavior
As this is an Apple iCloud calendar and is specifically an ical Calendar, it should work, even though the URL is obfuscated for the principal folder where the Calendar resides. iCloud is a popular calendar and one which we should expect to work for clients.

h3. Actual behavior
Actual behavior is such that the URL does not fetch from a wget, in fact the output is somewhat disheartening (screen4.png - attached).

It does work on a Mac, but not in Team Calendars.

h3. Related Notes
Some people have hacked DNS to build entries to their shared calendars and hacked Google to build a shareable URL with Google calendars: http://icaltogcal.com, but nothing seems to work with Team Calendars. Suppose a workaround might be to import it into Google Calendars and share that, but that is a hack, not really a solution that offers the Subscribe by URL method that is offered.

h3. Workaround
http and https prefix are now working for iCloud calendar subscription: change prefix from webcal to http or https to subscribe in Team Calendars. 
For example:
* webcal://p29-calendarws.icloud.com/ca/subscribe/1/ylFkt2Busa4o9Y-5TIDGL1tXOsin82JyqCIun8t1amMo0PC97k4DZMZ84YsSdiGb

change to:
* http://p29-calendarws.icloud.com/ca/subscribe/1/ylFkt2Busa4o9Y-5TIDGL1tXOsin82JyqCIun8t1amMo0PC97k4DZMZ84YsSdiGb
fields.summary: iCloud calendars for iCal URL not working

Confluence version: 5.8.15

I am not really sure who to recreate this bug, but I will do my best to describe it here.

Some of the changes made in the calendar online are not changed in the exported to the ics file.
For example, I created a series of entries. Then I realized, that they were off by on day. So I moved them and deleted some of the entries at the start of the series. It worked well at the online calendar, but at the ics which is used in e.g. Thunderbird, some of the removed entries are still in. 
This happens also if other colleges remove entries form series that have been there a while.

fields.description:
*Description:*
The [Subscribing+to+Email+Notifications+of+Updates+to+Confluence+Content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Subscribing+to+Email+Notifications+of+Updates+to+Confluence+Content] documentation mentions:
{quote}
*You will only receive notifications for content that you have permission to view.* Users that have been disabled by an administrator will not receive email notifications.
{quote}
However, if the user has no groups, they will not be able to view any content but will still receive notifications from Team Calendars, if they are have created the calendar.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Configure a Confluence to use Mail Server
# Install the Team Calendars plugin
# Create a new user with a valid e-mail address
# Log in with this user
# Create a new calendar with this new user
# Log out
# Log in with the admin user
# Add the calendar created by the new user
# Create an event on this calendar
# Check the new user's mail box for the mail notification about the new event
# Now remove all groups from the new user
# Go to the Team Calendars again and remove that event you've just created or create a new one
# Check the new user's mail box for the mail notification about the previous action

(!) You should not receive any notifications since this user does not have permission to view anything on Confluence any longer, but the notification is received anyway.

*Workaround:*
# Go to the _User Management_ section
# Find and select the new user
# Click on the _Disable_ button
fields.summary: Confluence mail notifications for users without groups
